revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Artist Discography |Artist = [[Garbage (band)|Garbage]] |Image = Garbage-2005-Copenhagen-3.jpg |Img = |Caption = Garbage performing on-stage in [[Copenhagen]], June 1, 2005 |Studio = 4 |Studio link = Studio albums |Compilation = 4 |Comp link = Compilations |Live = 1 |Live link = Live albums |Video = 2 |Video link = Compilations |Music videos = 25 |MV link = Music videos |Singles = 24 |Singles link = Singles |References = Yes |Ref link = References}} [[Garbage (band)|Garbage]] is a [[Scotland|Scottish]]-[[United States|American]] [[alternative rock]] band formed in [[Madison, Wisconsin|Madison]], [[Wisconsin]] in 1994. The group's discography consists of four studio albums, a greatest-hits compilation album, an [[extended play]] compilation, twenty-four [[Single (music)|singles]], twenty-five music videos (many of which are alternate versions to the same song), and two music-video compilations. The current line up is Scottish-born [[Shirley Manson]] and Americans [[Duke Erikson]], [[Steve Marker]], and [[Butch Vig]]. They have amassed worldwide album sales of over 17 million units.{{cite web | url = http://www.homecomingscotland2009.com/media-centre/shirleymanson.html | title = Famous Scots exhibition â Shirley Manson | publisher = homecomingscotland2009.com | accessdate = 28 November 2010}} Garbage released a string of increasingly successful singles in 1995 and 1996, including "[[Queer (song)|Queer]]", "[[Only Happy When It Rains]]", and "[[Stupid Girl (Garbage song)|Stupid Girl]]". Their debut album, ''[[Garbage (album)|Garbage]]'', was an [[Sleeper hit|unexpected smash]]; it charted in the top 20 in six countries and was certified [[Music recording sales certification|double platinum]] in the US, [[United Kingdom]], [[Canada]], and [[Australia]]. Garbage spent two years working on their follow-up album, ''[[Version 2.0]]'', which charted in the top 20 in 12 countries and was certified platinum in four countries and the [[European Union]]. The band recorded [[The World Is Not Enough (song)|the theme song]] of the 1999 [[James Bond]] movie ''[[The World Is Not Enough]]''.{{cite press release | title = Beautiful Garbage press release | publisher = Mushroom Records | date = 27 July 2001 | accessdate = 24 February 2008}} The band's third album, ''[[Beautiful Garbage]]'' (2001), failed to match the commercial success achieved by its predecessors.{{cite press release | title = Bleed Like Me press release | publisher = [[Geffen Records]] | date = 21 February 2005 | accessdate = 24 February 2008}} Garbage quietly disbanded in late 2003, but regrouped to complete their fourth album ''[[Bleed Like Me]]'' in 2005, peaking at a career-high number four on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. The band cut short their [[concert tour]] in support of ''Bleed Like Me'' announcing an "indefinite hiatus".{{cite web | url = http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1510121/20050922/garbage.jhtml | title = Shirley Manson On Garbage Hiatus: 'I'm Burnt, I'm Done, I'm Toast' says singer. | publisher = MTV | accessdate = 24 February 2008}} Garbage reconvened in 2007{{cite web | url = http://music.aol.com/popeater/2007/01/05/garbage-end-sabbatical-for-benefit-show/ | title = Garbage End Sabbatical for Benefit Show | publisher = [[AOL]] | accessdate = 24 February 2008}} and released a [[greatest hits]] compilation ''[[Absolute Garbage]]''.{{cite web | url = http://www.garbage.com/news/news.php?uid=336 | title = New Best Of Album | publisher = Garbage | accessdate = 24 February 2008}} ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {|class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:33px;"|Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:200px;"|Album details ! colspan="10"|Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:160px;"|[[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]

|align="left"| |''Absolute Garbage'' |- | colspan="15" style="text-align:center; font-size:8pt;"| "â" denotes releases that did not chart. |} '''I''' {{note|SV}} "Supervixen" was released to [[Modern rock|Modern Rock]] radio in the [[United States]] in October 1996.
'''II''' {{note|TW}} "Temptation Waits" was released to national radio in [[Spain]] in June 1999.
'''III''' {{note|BLM}} The entry for "Bleed Like Me" that charted on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|Hot Dance Music/Club Play]] chart was credited "Bleed Like Me (E. Kupper Mixes)".
* '''A''' {{note|Air}} Charted only on the [[Hot 100 Airplay]] chart.Per search of [http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/search/singles_chart_search.jsp Billboard.biz] and API: http://api.billboard.com/apisvc/chart/v1/list?artist=Green_Day&song=[title]&sdate=[Start date in yyyy-mm-dd format]&edate=[End date in yyyy-mm-dd format]&api_key=bvk4re5h37dzvx87h7rf5dqz * '''B''' {{note|Under}} Charted only on the Hot 100 Bubbling Under chart. * '''C''' {{note|Rock}} Charted only on the Hot 100 Rock Chart. * '''D''' {{note|Dance}} Charted only on the Hot 100 Dance Chart. ==Other appearances== ===Studio tracks=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
